intro: Psychotria franquevilleana, commonly known as the Franqueville's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
